HERITAGE.Definition: traditions, history, and culture from the past

PACKED UP.Definition: put things into bags or boxes to move

PERSPECTIVE.Definition: a way of thinking or viewpoint

NICHE.Definition: a small, special area of interest

LOBSTERS.Definition: sea animals with hard shells and claws

PILLOWS.Definition: soft things used to rest your head on in bed

MORE OFTEN THAN NOT.Definition: usually or most of the time

DISILLUSIONED.Definition: disappointed because something is not as good as expected

WILLING.Definition: happy or ready to do it

UNIONISED.Definition: having a workers' group that protects rights

UTOPIA.Definition: a perfect place where everything is great

BUREAUCRACY.Definition: a system with lots of rules and paperwork

INFURIATINGLY.Definition: in a way that makes someone very angry

CUT OFF.Definition: separated from or not connected to

BUREAUCRATIC.Definition: related to lots of rules and paperwork

PRIDE THEMSELVES.Definition: feel happy and satisfied about it

HURDLES.Definition: problems or difficulties that needed to be overcome

BORE.Definition: make you feel tired or not interested

TEDIOUS.Definition: boring and taking a long time

VICIOUS CIRCLE.Definition: a problem that kept making itself worse

NEATLY.Definition: in an organised and tidy way

ADJUSTMENT.Definition: a small change to get used to it

STRICTER.Definition: having more rules or being less easy-going

HIERARCHY.Definition: a system where some people are above others

FACTOR IN.Definition: include or think about it too

PRONOUNCED.Definition: very clear or easy to notice

BOUGHT INTO.Definition: agreeable with or willing to participate in

IN IT TOGETHER.Definition: sharing the same experience or problems

OLD MONEY.Definition: families that have been rich for a long time

TRAM.Definition: a train that runs on tracks in the city

HUMBLING.Definition: making you feel small or less important in a good way

STEADY.Definition: not changing much, staying the same

MEH.Definition: expressing a lack of interest or enthusiasm (exclamation)
